column6: This video will describe the layout of Rstudio and will get you oriented to the platform.
A longer introduction to RStudio with a little more time spent writing code and exploring the content that will be in each of the four panels in Rstudio.

column3: What are Data Structures in R?
column6: This is not a video, so the 10 min is an estimate on how long it will take to read.
This video will explain the different data structures, discuss elements of the data structures and import/export formats.
Emily Markowitz created a presentation on coding ettiquate which she presented in 2020 at a NOAA course called R for Social Scientists.
Part 1: Developed by RStudio - overall these videos are nicely explained and have good graphics.
Part 2:  Developed by Rstudio Two tidyverse packages, tidyr and dplyr, note that some functions have been replaced since this video was created we'll discuss that in class (pivot_longer, pivot_wider)
Part 3: Developed by Rstudio - Grammar of data manipulation with dplyr
Part 4: Developed by RStudio  - Binds, set operations and joins
